name: 2-pyridinecarboxamide, 3-hydroxy-
Reason: 2-Pyridinecarboxamide, 3-hydroxy- has a basic unit of pyridinecarboxamide, which has a melting point around 190°C. The presence of a hydroxy group in the 3-position can increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding and additional dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +10°C. However, the hydroxy group can also introduce a more polar character, which can disrupt the crystal lattice stability, potentially lowering the melting point by approximately -5°C. Summing up these changes: Pyridinecarboxamide base (+190°C), hydroxy group (+5°C), and polar character (-5°C).
